questions.a: A number that is evenly divisible by 2.
questions.b: A number that is a multiple of pi = 3.1416.
questions.c: A number that looks the same written backwards and forwards; for example 616.
questions.d: A whole number greater than 1 with only two whole-number factors: itself and 1.
questions.amp: The first few prime numbers are 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23, and 29. Prime numbers play a large role in number theory.

questions.q: Alice runs twice as fast as Jim.  If it takes Jim 12 minutes to run a mile, how long will it take Alice to run a mile?
questions.amp: Since Alice takes twice as fast, she will take half the time as Jim.  (12 minutes/2) = 6 minutes.

questions.q: Counting upward from zero, what is the third prime number encountered?
questions.amp: The first four prime numbers are 2, 3, 5, and 7, so the third prime is 5.
